availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Union Home Guard unit. Commanded by Captain. William E. Wortham. Organized in 1861. Engaged in skirmish near Mammoth Cave. Along with members of several other Home Guard units, chased a band of 43 Confederate guerrillas about 40 miles from the direction of Leitchfield, Grayson County. Rock Creek Home Guard killed or captured all of them in the skirmish near Mammoth Cave.

bibl.p: Hon. Elihu Root, Secretary of War, The War of the Rebellion: A Compilation of the Official Records of the Union and Confederate Armies, (Washington, DC: Government Printing Office, 1902), 1167.

Secretary of War, The War of the Rebellion: A Complication of the Official Records of the Union and Confederate Armies. Series I- Volume XI. Part I-Reports, (Washington, DC: Government Printing Office, 1886), 861-862.
